result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond L. Oleson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Illegal Hunting Deer/Carcass, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.971(11).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment within 30 days, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant to be subject to random and frequent UA testing by his agent.  Attend and successfully complete CGIP, if available.

records.addlTxt: Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Not to exercise any Chapter 29 privileges. No firearms. REPORT FOR BOOKING
